t: Psalm 106
Praise*pn the Lord.*s Give*pn thanks to the Lord,*s for he is good; his*ld love endures forever.
Who*pn can proclaim the mighty acts of the Lord*s or*ld fully declare his praise?
Blessed*ln are those who act justly, who*ld always do what is right.
Remember*pn me, Lord,*s when you show favor to your people, come*ld to my aid when you save them,
that*ln I may enjoy the prosperity of your chosen ones, that*ld I may share in the joy of your nation and*ld join your inheritance in giving praise.
We*pn have sinned, even as our ancestors did; we*ld have done wrong and acted wickedly.
When*ln our ancestors were in Egypt, they*ld gave no thought to your miracles; they*ln did not remember your many kindnesses, and*ld they rebelled by the sea, the Red Sea.
Yet*ln he saved them for his name’s sake, to*ld make his mighty power known.
He*ln rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up; he*ld led them through the depths as through a desert.
He*ln saved them from the hand of the foe; from*ld the hand of the enemy he redeemed them.
The*ln waters covered their adversaries; not*ld one of them survived.
Then*ln they believed his promises and*ld sang his praise.
But*pn they soon forgot what he had done and*ld did not wait for his plan to unfold.
In*ln the desert they gave in to their craving; in*ld the wilderness they put God to the test.
So*ln he gave them what they asked for, but*ld sent a wasting disease among them.
In*pn the camp they grew envious of Moses and*ld of Aaron, who was consecrated to the Lord.*s
The*ln earth opened up and swallowed Dathan; it*ld buried the company of Abiram.
Fire*ln blazed among their followers; a*ld flame consumed the wicked.
At*ln Horeb they made a calf and*ld worshiped an idol cast from metal.
They*ln exchanged their glorious God for*ld an image of a bull, which eats grass.
They*ln forgot the God who saved them, who*ld had done great things in Egypt,
miracles*ln in the land of Ham and*ld awesome deeds by the Red Sea.
So*ln he said he would destroy them— had*ld not Moses, his chosen one, stood*ln in the breach before him to*ld keep his wrath from destroying them.
Then*pn they despised the pleasant land; they*ld did not believe his promise.
They*ln grumbled in their tents and*ld did not obey the Lord.*s
So*ln he swore to them with uplifted hand that*ld he would make them fall in the wilderness,
make*ln their descendants fall among the nations and*ld scatter them throughout the lands.
They*pn yoked themselves to the Baal of Peor and*ld ate sacrifices offered to lifeless gods;
they*ln aroused the Lord’s*s anger by their wicked deeds, and*ld a plague broke out among them.
But*ln Phinehas stood up and intervened, and*ld the plague was checked.
This*ln was credited to him as righteousness for*ld endless generations to come.
By*ln the waters of Meribah they angered the Lord,*s and*ld trouble came to Moses because of them;
for*ln they rebelled against the Spirit of God, and*ld rash words came from Moses’ lips.
They*pn did not destroy the peoples as*ld the Lord*s had commanded them,
but*ln they mingled with the nations and*ld adopted their customs.
They*ln worshiped their idols, which*ld became a snare to them.
They*ln sacrificed their sons and*ld their daughters to false gods.
They*ln shed innocent blood, the*ld blood of their sons and daughters, whom*ln they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan, and*ld the land was desecrated by their blood.
They*ln defiled themselves by what they did; by*ld their deeds they prostituted themselves.
Therefore*pn the Lord*s was angry with his people and*ld abhorred his inheritance.
He*ln gave them into the hands of the nations, and*ld their foes ruled over them.
Their*ln enemies oppressed them and*ld subjected them to their power.
Many*ln times he delivered them, but*ld they were bent on rebellion and*ld they wasted away in their sin.
Yet*ln he took note of their distress when*ld he heard their cry;
for*ln their sake he remembered his covenant and*ld out of his great love he relented.
He*ln caused all who held them captive to*ld show them mercy.
Save*pn us, Lord*s our God, and*ld gather us from the nations, that*ln we may give thanks to your holy name and*ld glory in your praise.
Praise*pn be to the Lord,*s the God of Israel, from*ld everlasting to everlasting. Let*pn all the people say, “Amen!” Praise*pn the Lord.*s
